value.title: Like Brad Pitt, do you have trouble recognizing people? It may be prosopagnosia or 'face blindness'
value.excerpt: Actor Brad Pitt recently shared that he believes he has prosopagnosia, or "face blindness." Fox News Digital interviewed an expert about this troubling neurological condition.

value.title: Mashgin taps computer vision to improve checkout experience
value.excerpt: With its computer vision-powered self-checkouts, Mashgin wants to drive the future of the checkout experience at stadiums and grocery stores.

value.title: Designing next generation analog chipsets for AI applications
value.excerpt: Researchers at the Indian Institute of Science (IISc) have developed a design framework to build next-generation analog computing chipsets that could be faster and require less power than the digital chips found in most electronic devices.

value.title: Facial recognition works on seals. No, really.
value.excerpt: SealNet is a brand new facial recognition for, you guessed it, seals. Biologists have been training and testing it in Maine for two years.

value.title: Facial recognition software, mental healthcare in schools among 63 new Alabama laws

value.title: Tesla Reportedly Lays Off 200 Autopilot Employees
value.excerpt: In early June, Tesla CEO Elon Musk reportedly told executives that Tesla needed to cut 10% of its staff, based on a "super bad feeling" about the economy. Now, as Tesla pares back its workforce, new reports are highlighting where some of those cuts are taking place.

value.title: Australian retail giants named in facial recognition tech complaint
value.excerpt: Three of Australia's biggest retail chains have been referred to the privacy regulator for recommended enforcement action by a major consumer group which has said they use "unreasonably intrusive" facial recognition technology on customers.

value.title: Microsoft is removing emotion recognition features from its facial recognition tech
value.excerpt: Emotion recognition technology typically relies on software to look at any number of qualities — facial expressions, tone of voice or word choice — in an effort to automatically detect emotional state.

value.title: India to get facial recognition tech at airports: Understanding how it will work

value.title: American Airlines testing face-scanning at DFW Airport
